subject: Programming
title: Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Motivation
description: One-minute skill: Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Motivation.

hook.text: A programmer given a cash bonus for fixing bugs starts to hate fixing bugs. Rewards can backfire.

buildup.text: Intrinsic motivation comes from within â€” curiosity, mastery, purpose. Extrinsic comes from rewards.

discovery.text: Daniel Pink's research shows autonomy, mastery, and purpose drive developers more than money alone.

twist.text: External rewards for creative work can actually reduce motivation. The overjustification effect is real.

climax.text: The best engineering cultures give developers hard problems, autonomy, and a sense of purpose.

punchline.text: Purpose and mastery beat bonuses every time.

quiz.question: What three things drive developer motivation according to Daniel Pink?
